review.comment_positive:
Iâ€™ve previously visited Hoi An and have stayed in a few hotels and honestly, La Charm is the stand out for me. It ticks all of the boxes in terms of amenities, service and rooms.

But itâ€™s the small details that really make this a cut above the rest. From the super attentive and friendly staff who got to know us and would check in to see how we were doing; the bright and bubbly housekeeping crew whoâ€™d greet us each day, to having everything we needed in our room so we never had to ask for anything else. Breakfast buffet had a great selection of items, the pool area was a great place to chill, the vibes overall exuded brightness, warmth and happiness.

Location-wise, itâ€™s in a fairly quiet area, just outside of the hustle and bustle of the old town but walkable distance to everything. And if youâ€™re ever feeling lazy or unable to walk, you could easily book a cheap ride with Grab.

Loved our stay here!
review.comment_negative: The only thing (although completely out of the control of the hotel) was a neighbouring rooster whoâ€™d crow each morning. Iâ€™d assume this would have only affected rooms located on the side of the hotel we were staying in. Just bring earplugs and youâ€™ll be fine. Everything else about the hotel is amazing!

review.comment_positive: The Property is beautiful and clean. The staff was just amazing, very friendly and welcoming. We felt absolutely comfortable there. review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra Khu Phá»‘ Cá»•
review.comment_positive:
This property really is a â€˜charmingâ€™ hotel. It full of colour and beautifully decorated, extremely clean and the staff in particular are noteworthy as they pay keen attention to you from the moment you enter. Ms Thao as soon as I arrived helped figure out my plans for Hoi An based on our preferred activities and quickly arranged everything. For me this was extremely helpful as I was only in Hoi An for a very few days and wanted to make the most of my time. The staff will check in with you daily on the room condition, any issues that need to be addressed. They were not at all overbearing might I add- itâ€™s just a really helpful way they have to make sure guests are ok. You also get treats when you check out â˜ºï¸. 

The breakfast is the best spread for a hotel of this range in Vietnam that I have had and for this price. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and my room was exactly as indicated in the pictures on the site and booking.com. 

Had an excellent pedicure at the spa. They have a well equipped gym and a lovely pool and quiet space which again is a huge plus point! There are also bicycles to use available for free. Additionally to note the location of the hotel is in a quieter part of the town away from the immediate hustle and bustle, but all the action can be accessed with a safe and easy 3-5 minute walk.

This hotel has a lot of charm & character while being delightfully 5â˜† quality.
The staff were so attentive to our every need. We found the pillows a little high for our preference, but when I mentioned it, they were replaced in 10 mins.
Breakfast has so many choices and all delicious. 
The room & bathroom are spacious & stylish and the beds very comfortable. 
The staff gave us many recommendations for food & tailor & jewellery and they were also very good recommendations... (especially the Bahn My)

Our room was huge, the hotel staff was efficient whenever you needed any assistance, and they provided a quick laundry service with great ironing, as well as free bikes for riding around Hoi An. 
I highly recommend this hotelğŸ‘

review.comment_positive: Every staff member was warm and welcoming and remembered us. They were full of suggestions of things to see and do (Donâ€™t miss Memories of Hoi An - itâ€™s amazing!) The hotel itself is beautiful inside and out and our rooms were comfortable in every way with all the amenities. The buffet breakfast was superb. The pool was really lovely and we always found somewhere to sit and read after a dip. I used the spa for a massage and a gel pedicure and I am admiring my perfect toes right now! The spa had the usual serene music, aromatherapy scents and ginger tea and biscuits. We could walk into the old town along the river in a reasonable time. This is a very pretty hotel in the prettiest town in Vietnam.

review.comment_positive: Overall we had a great experience in La Charm: the staff was super helpful and polite, the property clean and comfortable, the breakfast had the biggest variety we experienced in Vietnam, and the pool are was definitely our savior during the afternoon heat. The location is also great, less than 10 minutes walk from the old town, so a really pleasant walk after dinner.
review.comment_negative: Unfortunately, the soundproofing is pretty much nonexistent in the building. We really planned Hoi An to be the peaceful harbor during our Vietnam trip where we just unwind and sleep in for a few days but we had no chance with all the noise around us starting from 6am. Of course, I don't blame the property for a a really loud construction next door, but the soundproofing should definitely be improved: roosters sounded as they were crowing in our room and we heard every word of the cleaning staff talking to there walkie talkies, so for a light sleeper like myself this left its stamp on the whole experience.

review.comment_positive:
This hotel has it all.
Great location, room, food, but what sets it apart from the rest is its EXCEPTIONAL staff.
From the chaps on the door to the team in the restaurant to the ladies on reception, every single one of them goes out of their way to make sure you're happy. A special mention to Ms Nga on reception, who took care of us via constant communication before our visit, to sorting out everything for us on arrival.
And the brilliant Huong (and her friend) in the restaurant who brightened our morning every day with their beautiful smiles and cheerful nature.
Staying in Hoi An, then this hotel is a shining beacon in a place of a thousand lanterns.

review.comment_positive:
Great location to spend time in Hoi An old town. 
Very friendly and welcoming staff, so kind, helpful and accommodating with lots of great suggestions for things to do and places to go. 
The swimming pool! Very long, clean and a good temperature. 
Free bike hire of good quality bikes and La Charm made it so easy to do, just stepping out the hotel and being helped to take a bike - we loved cycling to the beach (took about 30 mins each way).
Large and extremely comfortable bed and great shower. Also a free standing bath!
We spent most time out of the hotel exploring, but it was a great base to come back to and things we arranged with La Charm (like bikes, airport transfer, laundry) went very smoothly.

Highly recommend and would stay here again.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the hotel. After backpacking for 6 weeks so far this was a beautiful property to stay in. We were greeted with complementary drinks on arrival. The property was in an ideal location. Short walk to the night market and to old town. Lovely facilities including a fabulous pool and a small gym and spa. The hotel also provide free bikes to cycle around the town. 
Breakfast was 10/10 with so much options from Asian and western backgrounds. The property was very clean and the room was cleaned each day with fresh sheets and towels provided. 
Staff were fantastic, especially Loan who went out of her way to assist us. Loan helped us with booking of the cooking class and coconut boat tour alongside providing numerous recommendations for activities to do in Hoi An. 
Would highly recommend Le Charm for your visit to Hoi an.

review.rating: Had a great time at La Charm, where the staff went the extra mile to ensure we had a good stay.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra Khu Phá»‘ Cá»•
review.comment_positive: The staff at La Charm were incredibly helpful and polite from check-in to check-out. During our stay they were always willing to provide suggestions of activities, and were very helpful in booking tours and assisting with out flights. The pool area and garden was lovely to spend time in. Although the pool is a bit chilly in winter, it was still good for swimming, and the floating breakfast adds a touch of luxury to the stay at La Charm. The room we stayed in was spacious and clean, with a very large bed. The bathroom was also spacious, with a shower and bath. The shower had good temperature and water pressure.
review.comment_negative: The rooms are not very sound-proof, and you can often hear staff/other visitors outside the room early in the morning, as well as a lot of noise from the streets and surrounds. The door to the balcony cannot be fully closed from the outside. The bed was large and comfortable, however an additional pillow per person would have been good.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe 3 NgÆ°á»i/Gia ÄÃ¬nh
review.comment_positive:
Unforgettable Stay at La Charm Hotel, Hoi An

From the moment we checked into La Charm Hotel, it was clear we were in for a treat. The beds were not just comfortable, they were like sleeping on a cloud, ensuring a restful night's sleep after a day of exploring Hoi An. What truly set this hotel apart was the service; the staff went above and beyond in every interaction, making us feel both valued and cared for.

Located conveniently away from the bustling noise, the hotel offers a serene retreat. Each morning, we were greeted with an unbelievably delicious breakfast, featuring a wide variety of choices that tantalized our taste buds and energized us for the day.

The staff deserve a special mention for their friendliness and efficiency. Their quick service and the overall cleanliness of the hotel were commendable. As for the price, it was more than fair, especially considering the high level of service and the quality of the accommodations.

Our family room, which comfortably accommodated three people, was a highlight. Spacious and well-appointed, it catered to our every need. The hotelâ€™s communication, from booking to check-out, was very clear and responsive, ensuring a hassle-free experience.

In summary, La Charm Hotel is a gem in Hoi An. With its combination of comfort, service, and value, it's an ideal choice for travelers seeking a memorable stay in this charming city.

review.rating: Wonderful hotel, made Hoi An extra special
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n CÃ³ Cá»­a Sá»•
review.comment_positive:
I have stayed in many hotels in Vietnam  and this was my absolute favourite. Firstly, the staff are incredible. So friendly and helpful. They advised us about the Bamboo circus and arranged tickets for us, and this ended up being a highlight of our trip to Hoi An. They also gave advice on things to do and tours available, and arranged anything we wanted to do. This was all at no extra cost


The pool was lovely, it's very quiet in the day so you can get a sun lounger, and there is lots of shade. Thr beach towels thsy provide were great. I loved the pool area, it's a decent length as well - about 18 metres.

For us the location of the hotel was perfect, away from the hustle and bustle of the old town but only a short walk away. Really loved the bikes that the hotel had available (for free), we used these to cycle to An Bang beach

Our room was huge and had a balcony. The hotel is spotlessly clean too.

There was a wide range of options at breakfast, and I liked the egg station very much. 

Thank you to Ms Thao and the team, you made our stay really special and I was sad to leave.

review.comment_positive: This was the most lovely hotel to stay at - the rooms were beautiful, spacious and well cleaned and even though one of our rooms was upgraded, it was bigger rather than any better than the other.  The buffet breakfast was outstanding - they do host tours so it can be busy at times.  The pool was really cooling on a hot day and the area well maintained with pool towels and drinks available.  There are free bicycles outside to use and super friendly and helpful reception will book you anything you'd like to do and suggest options for sightseeing, tailors, etc.  You can easily walk a short distance to the main tourist areas of Hoi An, but this hotel is in a quieter part of town.  We really felt like they wanted to ensure our stay was exceptional and they succeeded.
review.comment_negative: There is a building site next to the pool, but I think they played a watery noise to ensure it wasn't really a problem.  The property isn't on online maps so screenshot or take the address to show it to taxi drivers, etc. - I believe they're addressing this issue.

The best part of La Charm is the staff. Everyone from reception to bellboy, They are so warm and happy. This is why I prefer smaller, more intimate ( independent?) places. Manager tells me this is a 7 year hotel that was closed for 2 years due to covid, so now they are so grateful to be back. Itâ€™s spanking new at 2 months, even the gym equipment has its protective jackets on. As a result, the current prices at sep 2023 are so ridiculously low. Iâ€™ve never seen anyth at this quality level for the price in vietnam. The new spa is also doing a one for one currently (up to usd30 for 2 hrs..so i went everyday) , big shoutout to masseuse song for accomodating all my needs and pains, which didnâ€™t happen when i went to a much more expensive spa nearby
review.comment_negative: Currently at sep 2023 there is some construction just across the road. Its bearable and ok, no banging but those sensitive to sounds could avoid the corner rooms facing the road. In vietnam & when travelling tho, itâ€™s always wise to keep your valuables close

review.comment_positive:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at La Charm Hotel in Hoi An, Vietnam, and it was an absolute delight from start to finish. During my three-night stay, I experienced nothing short of exceptional hospitality and service.

First and foremost, the staff at La Charm Hotel are truly outstanding. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with warm smiles and genuine care. They went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was comfortable and memorable. Their attention to detail and willingness to assist with any request truly set them apart.

The accommodations at La Charm Hotel were superb. My room was spacious, impeccably clean, and beautifully decorated, providing the perfect retreat after a day of exploring Hoi An. The amenities were top-notch, and I especially enjoyed relaxing by the pool, which offered a tranquil oasis in the heart of the city.

In addition to the fantastic amenities, the staff at La Charm Hotel also helped me arrange some unforgettable experiences during my stay. They assisted me in booking a scooter tour, allowing me to explore the stunning countryside surrounding Hoi An with ease. They also organized a cooking class, where I had the opportunity to learn traditional Vietnamese recipes from skilled chefs.

Overall, my experience at La Charm Hotel was nothing short of exceptional. From the luxurious accommodations to the outstanding service and unforgettable experiences, every aspect of my stay exceeded my expectations. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough to anyone visiting Hoi An. It truly is a hidden gem that deserves to be discovered and celebrated.

review.comment_positive:
It was in a great location just on the edge of the main area,and 1 block away from the river. Everywhere was walkable.

The staff were so friendly and service was impeccable- they could not do enough for their guests. 

Room was spacious with a balcony, bed was large and comfortable and the bathroom was quite luxurious. Elevators were quick (we were on the top floor). The pool was nice and long making it easy to go good lengths of swimming. Sun beds were comfortable and towels were provided.

Breakfast had a good choice of Asian and European and staff were quick in clearing tables and topping up the buffet. 

We had a really nice stay here. Lovely property, and friendly staff who enjoyed chatting to guests was just perfect for me.

Wir hatten ein schÃ¶nes und ruhiges Zimmer auf hÃ¶chster Ebene (7. Stock).
Das Badezimmer ist gut und gerÃ¤umig.
Das Schlafzimmer ist grundsÃ¤tzlich auch gerÃ¤umig. Da wir ein Kingsize Bett wollten, wurden uns zwei groÃŸe Betten nebeneinander gestellt, was toll war, den Platz im Zimmer jedoch etwas einschrÃ¤nkte. Was aber fÃ¼r unsere drei NÃ¤chte auch nicht weiter schlimm war und wir wollten diese BettgrÃ¶sse selbst.
Was etwas stÃ¶rend war, war die LautstÃ¤rke der Klimaanlage. Ab und an hat die Klimaanlage sehr laute GerÃ¤usche gemacht. Da wir beide nachts sehr tief schlafen, haben wir dem Personal nichts davon gesagt. Erst als wir beim auschecken gefragt wurden. Das Personal hat sich sehr dafÃ¼r entschuldigt und wollte uns dafÃ¼r 200.000 VDN als EntschÃ¤digung geben. Dies haben wir aber nicht angenommen und gebeten, dem Hotelpersonal zukommen zu lassen.

Das Personal im gesamten Hotel ist sehr sehr freundlich.
Besonders Ms. Uyen an der Rezeption ist sehr freundlich. Schon bei der Anreise hat sie uns mit den wichtigsten Informationen versorgt. Ãœber sie haben wir auch zwei AusflÃ¼ge gebucht ( einmal Memories Land und coconut boot) alles verlief unkompliziert und gut organisiert

review.comment_positive:
The  best hotel Iâ€™ve been in Asia! Everything was just perfect: The hotel is new, the room was tastefully furnished, large enough for two people, there was also a desk, chair, a small sofa and three night-stands. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well, as the street is sufficiently quiet. 
The pool in the garden is large, there are sunbeds and towels available. The small gym is well equipped. 
Ms Nga at the reception desk was extremely kind and helpful, she gave us tips where to do shopping and even booked several train-tickets for our further travels for us. 
The breakfast is plentiful, versatile and delicious! 
Five minutes walk to the busy old-town, moreover, bikes can be borrowed for free (20-min. ride to A Bang-beach). 
The staff are very kind, efficient and highly professional. 
We felt so comfortable and well cared for that we even prolonged our stay!

review.comment_positive: Nice location, 8 minute walk into old town Hoi An. This hotel reopened (after COVID) 2 months before we stayed-and staffing was excellent, very helpful, and the decor with the coloured tiles and lanterns are nostalgic and romantic.  The breakfast very good, a variety of choices and everything was super clean.  The outdoor swimming pool was of a very good size, in terms of its length. Nice cooling after a day out!  Best of all, relatively inexpensive, therefore great value for money.  However I would guess as the tourism industry recovers more, prices may go up.  I think Hoi An has lots to offer and we stayed here 4 nights and enjoyed every moment.  We booked a private guide ahead of time but if you like more freedom you can book day trips at the hotel as needed, for flexibility. We also used the spa for massages and your USD goes a long way!
review.comment_negative: Nothing really to complain about.  I think underrated place.  But I like it as it is a smaller town and not so commercialized.  E.g. No McDonalds in town! Excellent!

The hotel is charming. The deepest impression was that literally all the staff made an effort to make the guest feels welcome. The staff are friendly and helpful.
Location: It is at a good quiet neighbourhood a short walk to old town and the japanese bridge (the japanese bridge is under total renovation right now - look to me it was knocked down and rebuilt with new technology. Will they preserve history or let history be history?)
Hotel Room: big, comfortable, bed is super big. Enough space to put luggage and not get in the way. room as a balcony. Water is hot enough, shower water pressure is strong enough to have a good refreshing shower.

Facilities: The swimming pool not too big but cozy. the garden has some good spots for photos. A decent gym but few guest use them.

Everything about the hotel is perfect, the staff is extremely friendly, everyone that we met tried their best to help us. At the beginning they explained us Everything that we should know about the city on the map, they gave us tips about touristic things. The room is big, clean, the pool is bigger than it seems on the photos, the location is great, very close to old town, you can use bicycles for free to see around. They have an aggrement with a nice beach clup at the most famous beach so you can use it free too. The spa is also professional. The breakfast is more than enough. They have a nice restaurant too. They can arrange you pickup from airport for a reasonable price. At the end they gave me a gift which was very polite. 
I would definitely stay here again

review.comment_positive: I like the indoor spaces, wide and well decorated, well done!! The rooms were fine and the view from our bedroom was nice, also the terrace was European style. Good choices for breakfast and nice swimming pool area. Also the guy who welcome you at the entrance is super nice!!
review.comment_negative:
Well... I have a couple of suggestions:
1) at breakfast, cover the food. It is a hot place and there are flies. It has been underwhelming seeing the disregard of the staff for flies going on food. I know local people are used to worse and English people probably don't care, but it is still unacceptable. I can't give more than 3 stars just for this one.
2) Bathrooms were fine, probably high standard for non-European people. However, it was missing both the anti-slip mat inside the shower and the mat out of the shower, basic things in the bathroom. Also, the shower itself was leaking water out of the shower area.
In regards to another thing we did not like, I can say we both felt squeezed in the swimming pool area, as it is obvious they built it around existing buildings. Also, the view of a skyscraper skeleton from one side and a poor house right next to the swimming pool is not great.

review.comment_positive:
Well this hotel definitely lives up to it name! The staff were beyond helpful  without being intrusive , every query was met with earnest and helpful assistance . honestly sad to leave , whether it was finding a table for breakfast or looking for advice on local tours I was always looked after with a genuine helpfulness and a friendly attitude .
When I was told this hotel had only reopened less than a month ago I was shocked because what I found here was a well oiled machine . many thanks to Ms. Nga and Lucky in particular .

For location you couldnâ€™t find a better , a stones throw from the famous night market but in a location away from the noise . 
the amenities where excellent , the pool and spa in particular . I made particular use of the hotels bicycles which are free to use as this is a cycle friendly place . 

The room and standards of cleaning were excellent , room service was fast and efficient and the food restaurant quality , I found myself quickly wanting to try everything on the menu . 

I will be recommending this location to any and all who wish to spend time in Hoi An .

review.comment_positive: Last year I stayed at La Charm for the first time and was very satisfied with my stay there. So, when I returned to Hoi An this spring La Charm was my obvious choice. I think the location is just perfect as it is situated close to the river in a quiet area with little traffic, and the centre of Hoi An is only a nice 10-minute walk along the river. Even when you compare La Charm to 5-star hotels in Hoi An, La Charm comes out very favourable, and in my option none of those has such a nice location. The rooms are spacious and nicely laid out, with a very comfortable big bed. Breakfast is delicious and have many variants. I recommend borrowing one of the hotel free bikes and explore the countryside to see some of the surroundings. Of all of La Charmâ€™s assets the staff is the biggest one. All are super friendly, and they care for you and remember you when you return which you will! The quality/price ratio of La Charm is unbeatable, and I am already planning my next stay there.

We stayed at La Charm Hotel on our Wedding Anniversary Day... They gave us a beautiful surprise by decorating our room...
Room was really spacious and comfortable with all necessary requirements...
Bathroom was huge with bath tub and shower in it and most importantly very clean...
Breakfast buffet had so many good options to eat... I am Vegan so staff helped me with a vegan fried noodles cooked specially for me...
They have good tour options and also helped us book a good car to Airport.
It is located very near to Ancient town and night market... They provide bicycle for commute.
On Checkout, staff greeted us with so much warmth and love; gifted us with two boxes of coconut cookies as a souvenir...
We just spent a night here but I will always remember our staff at La Charm Hotels...
Highly recommended Guys...
Must stay here for amazing experience as they have reasonably good spa options too.
Keep up the good work La Charm Hotels team and best wishes...

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at La Charm Hotel. The hotel is exceptionally well kept, the staff are very friendly, and the facilities are excellent. This is the best place weâ€™ve stayed in Vietnam.
Great location, a short 5 minute walk to the old town, or even faster using the free bikes offered by La Charm. 
We enjoyed the included breakfast every morning. The pool and loungers were also a great spot to relax.
The staff gave me a cake and set up our room specifically for my birthday. We didnâ€™t tell them it was my birthday so this was an awesome surprise.
Finally, the hotel has a small gym with some basic weights, treadmills and spin bikes. You donâ€™t find gyms often in Vietnam hotels so I enjoyed fitting a quick run in during our time here.
Overall, a great hotel and good value for money. We will be back if we return to Hoi An.

We stayed two nights in La Charm Hoi An Hotel & Spa. We had a wonderful stay.

The location is absolutely perfect, 5 minutes walk to the Ancient Town. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The breakfast buffet is very good.

And last but not leastâ€¦ The staffâ€¦ They are amazing ! A real 5-star service.

Thao did our check-in and she did great. She made us feel very welcome and asked us if we had any plans in Hoi An. She introduced us what to do in Hoi An and the area. It was really nice. This way we were able to have a first idea of all the main things to do.

A big thank you to all the staff and especially Nga who took excellent care of us during all our stay. She was super friendly and helpful. She really went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. It felt like having our personal concierge. We had great recommendations from her, she booked the basket boat tour for us, the tickets for Teh Dar Show which is an absolute must, this show was absolutely incredible ! Nga also anticipated our needs by asking where were we going next and she offered to book the flight tickets with a transfer to the airport for us. She did everything and everything was added on the room bill which was very convenient. 

So if you are thinking about booking this hotel for your stay in Hoi An, donâ€™t hesitate, do it, you will have an amazing stay for sure ! I recommend this establishment 100%.

review.comment_positive: This is a gem of a hotel in Hoi An and we absolutely loved our stay here. It offers great value for money and feels very luxurious. Our room was very spacious and comfortable and had a lovely view of Hoi An. The staff (especially Na and the other ladies at reception) were all very warm, friendly and helpful, going out of their way to speak to us and help us to plan our stay in Hoi An. They helped us with booking day trips, show tickets and we were able to rent bicycles for free. The buffet breakfast is great and staff tried to accommodate our needs by providing extra vegan options during our stay. Highly recommend staying here!
review.comment_negative: The only problem we had was that there were a lot of mosquitoes in our room (bathroom in particular). Staff did their best to help with this by spraying the area for us but the mosquitoes seemed to return after the cleaners had been in and opened doors/windows. If the hotel is able to take a few extra steps to keep mosquitoes out, it really would be perfect.

PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n Thá»i ThÆ°á»£ng CÃ³ Ban CÃ´ng & Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra Há»“ BÆ¡i
review.comment_positive:
This might be the best hotel I ever stayed in. If not the best, definitely my favourite. So where to start?

Rooms are clean, large, and modern. I got one with a balcony and it was worth the extra expense. The pool area is brilliant with beds of different types and a great mix of sun and shade. You could spend all day there.

The staff are incredible. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever experienced a group that is so intent on exceeding guest expectations at every opportunity. From your welcome drink to your checkout, they go over and above. Nothing is too much trouble. 

Location is the best in Hoi Ann. I did a fair bit of walking around and can say that with 100% confidence. Only 5 minutes to the old town but in a quiet area so you can escape the chaos when you want to wind down. Free bicyles a great perk too. You can ride to the countryside in less than 10 minutes.

I didnâ€™t do any activities through the hotel, but they can organize pretty much anything. You always pay a little more than if you do it yourself but thatâ€™s to be expected. Most tours looked pretty good value. They did organise an airport drop off for me at 3:45am (brutal I know) and that went very smoothly. 

I had one meal at the hotel. It was nice and the menu pricing was reasonable. Again, slightly higher than if you went outside but you expect that and still cheap by western standards. Breakfast buffet was great with heaps of choices. 

Overall, I would highly recommend La Charm for anyone coming to Hoi An. It really captures the charm (pun intended) of the town, whilst matching the service standards you would expect from a larger hotel chain. Well done and thank you!
review.comment_negative:
I did identify a couple of small opportunities that could make the hotel even better. 

Firstly, the gym. There is a decently sized dedicated space but itâ€™s a few pieces of equipment off being usable for a regular gym goer. If La Charm invested in a dumbbell rack with different sized dumbbells and a cable crossover machine with different handles you could do pretty much any workout there. Itâ€™s still much better than a lot of hotel gyms in Vietnam, but given the effort to carve out the space, it seems a waste not to finish it off with those last few pieces of equipment. 

Secondly, I have dietary restrictions and it would be great if the hotel menu listed allergens. For example, putting a GF or DF beside food items to say whether they are gluten free or dairy free. Itâ€™s very common in western countries but nobody does it in Vietnam which makes dining out a hassle. Plenty of guests like me would appreciate it and as a bonus would probably eat most their meals at the hotel. Youâ€™d even get outsiders coming in to eat once word got out.

The pool was also a welcome relief at the end of sightseeing in very hot weather.
Breakfast is plentiful and delicious. 
We will definitely stay here again when visiting Hoi An.

review.comment_positive: We loved the convenience of free bike hire. We used them every day! We took the bikes out at 6am each day and ride through the rice paddies and quiet outskirts of town! Then we came back to a lovely warm breakfast. Lots of food options and staff were so kind. They genuinely try to help with everything and go the extra mile. review.rating: The best hotel and the best quality service. I would recommend to anyone coming to Hoi An
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n CÃ³ Cá»­a Sá»•
review.comment_positive:
Absolutely excellent service. My friend and I have been travelling for 9 weeks now. Staying in 4/5 star hotels from Bali, Thailand, to Vietnam. This is our favourite. It is beautiful, situated in the heart of Han Oi, with bikes to travel to wherever we like. By far the best service we've had in the whole 9 weeks. The most warming welcome with a delicious fresh fruit juice and advice on an itinerary for our trip in Han Oi. Super helpful and friendly staff. They were always checking up on us and making sure we were happy. They gave us all the tips on where to go, if we needed anything they were there. We originally booked in for 1 night but we ended up staying 3 because of joe much we loved it. We got 2 for 1 on cocktails and also massages. We booked in an hour full body massage and it was delightful. We also did numerous activities that we booked through the hotel and they were the same price as what you would book through the website, this included a taxi to and from the hotel too.
We don't have a bad word to sav about this hotel and everything that comes with it. 10/10. Would come back in a heart beat.
